tr.td: For the Importation Gunpowder and Saltpetre, &c.
Liberty to all to import Gunpowder, paying Duties.
All Subjects may make and sell Gunpowder, and import Saltpetre, &c.
Putting in Execution Letters Patents, Proclamations, &c. against this Liberty—Premunire.
For the better settling of Intestates' Estates.

All Ordinaries who have Power to grant Administrations to take Bond—The Condition of the Bonds—Ordinaries may call Administrators to account and make Distribution amongst the Wife and Children, &c.—Appeal.

Proviso for Customs of London and Province of York, &c.
Explained 1 Jac. II. c. 17. § 8.

How and to whom Surplus to be distributed—Proviso respecting Advancement by Portion, &c. —Heir at Law, although he take Land, to have an equal Part—If no Children, then Moiety to Wife, and Residue to next of Kin.
Representation amongst—If no Children, then to next of Kin.
No Distribution till after One Year.
If Debts afterwards appear, then all to refund proportionably.
Proviso for Administration cum Testamento annexo.

Continuance of Act, Seven Years, &c.
This Act not to extend to Femes Covert intestate, 29 Car. II. c. 3. § 24. Continued for Seven Years, &c. 30 Car. II. c. 6. Made perpetual, 1 Jac. II. c. 17. § 5.
For the raising and levying Soldiers for Defence of England and Ireland.
For a Contribution for the Relief of Subjects of Ireland.
For the reducing of the Rebels in Ireland.
For adding to and explaining the above Act.
To enable Corporations, &c. to participate in the Benefit of the above Acts.
For the further Advancement of the Reduction of Rebels in Ireland.
To prevent Arrests of Judgments and superseding Executions.
In Verdicts in the Courts at Westminster, or in Chester, Lancaster, Durham, or Great Sessions in Wales—Judgment not to be stayed, &c. for Want of Form and other Matters in this Act mentioned.
Nor Judgments, after Verdict, Confession by Cognovit actionem, or Relicta verificatione, reversed for Matters herein mentioned.
In what Actions Executions not stayed by Writ of Error without Recognizance under Stat. 3 Jac. I. c. 8.
In Dower and Ejectment, Plaintiff in Error to give Security for Costs, Damages, and Money awarded.
Write of Inquiry of mesne Profits and Damages.
Proviso for Writs of Error in Actions by Execution, Actions, Popular, and on penal Statutes, except for Tithes and Indictments, &c.

Continuance of Act, Three Years, &c.
This Act made perpetual, 22 &23 Car. II. c.4. and virtually extended to Judgments upon Nihil dicit,&4 &5 Ann. c. 16. § 2. and to Writs of Mandamus, and Informations in Nature of a Quo Warranto, 9 Ann. c. 20. § 7.

entry.sub: See Arrest of Judgement. Frauds and Perjuries.

tr.td: Certain Acts and Proceedings not to be avoided.
Certain Fines and Proclamations since the Death of the late King, good.
Proviso for Fines and Recoveries of Lands in Durham.
The illegal Proceedings of the late High Courts of Justice not allowed.
Indictments of the Adherents of the Parliament, and of the late and present King, and all Grants thereupon, made void—and all Escheats, &c. restored.
Sales made by Ordinance of Parliament since 1st May 1642, not avoided or confirmed.
Recognizances, Obligations, &c. to the late Protectors (Exception), Judgments, &c. for the said Protectors, may be prosecuted in the Name and to the Use of the King (Exception).
Justices, Serjeants, Commissioners of Sewers, &c. of the late Powers not continued.
Writs of Error may be brought by Persons grieved by Judgments of the late Courts.
Proviso respecting Non-Claim upon Fines of Lands sold, &c. by Ordinance of Parliament since 1st of May 1642, and before 25th of April 1660.
The late Government declared to be usurped.
Recognition of His Majesty's just Title.
Indictments of Persons for levying Wars against Oliver Cromwell, &c. made void.
For the returning of able and sufficient Jurors.
Jurors returned on Trials of Issued, to be worth in Freehold Lands, &c. £20 per Annum (Exception).
Jurors in Wales, £8 per Annum—Cause of Challenge.
Issues of Jurymen making Default how saved.
The Form of the Venire facias.
Sheriff returning Jurors of less value—Penalty £5.
Sheriffs to give to the Sessions Names of Persons liable to be returned as Jurors.
Sessions may add Names omitted—No greater Number returnable than Sessions think fit.
Jurors to be summoned Six Days before they are to appear, and to have left with them the Names of Parties.
Sheriff, &c. taking Money to excuse Appearance—Penalty £10.—Proviso for ancient Usages.
Upon certain Writs of Venire facias in County Palatine of Lancaster—Habeas Corpora or Distringas to be sued out.
Jurymen how compelled to appear in the County Palatine of Lancaster.

Continuance of Act.
See 4 W. & M. c. 24. § 16—23.
